title: NotnotdNetHack
data:
- *Not to be confused with [notdnethack](/wiki/Notdnethack "Notdnethack").*

**notnotdnethack** is a [variant](/wiki/Variant "Variant") of [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") developed by [Noisytoot](/index.php?title=User:Noisytoot\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "User:Noisytoot (page does not exist)"), and is based on [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") like both notdNetHack and [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") are.

The entire repo can be viewed at [codeberg.org](https://codeberg.org/noisytoot/notnotdnethack/).

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Proper formatting to match other variant pages"*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 New races](#New_races)

  - [1.1 Octopode](#Octopode)
  - [1.2 (Parasitized) Android Illithanachronounbinder](#.28Parasitized.29_Android_Illithanachronounbinder)

- [2 Race/role changes](#Race.2Frole_changes)

- [3 New items](#New_items)

- [4 New options](#New_options)

- [5 Other changes](#Other_changes)

## New races

### Octopode

- *Main article: [Octopode (starting race)](/wiki/Octopode_\(starting_race\) "Octopode (starting race)")*

Octopodes are a race of [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") that can use their tentacles to walk on land, wear rings on each of the eight tentacles, and can also attack with them in melee to drown other monsters. They cannot wear most rigid armor, but can still make use of [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield") and barded [helms](/wiki/Helm "Helm") along with "soft" armor and also gain level-based bonuses to natural [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [DR](/wiki/DR "DR").

### (Parasitized) Android Illithanachronounbinder

[Androids](/wiki/Android "Android") can be played as [Illithanachronounbinders](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder"), which makes them a playable version of the [parasitized android](/index.php?title=Parasitized_android\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized android (page does not exist)"). Unlike other androids, Android Illithanachronounbinders are considered living monsters due to the presence of the parasite; they also no longer start with [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance") or [breathlessness](/wiki/Breathlessness "Breathlessness"), and instead start with [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), [R'lyehian sight](/index.php?title=R%27lyehian_sight\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "R'lyehian sight (page does not exist)") and [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") as parasitized androids do. Android Illithanachronounbinders still begin with [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance"), and gain [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 5, [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") at experience level 10 and [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") at experience level 15.

## Race/role changes

- [Chiropterans](/wiki/Chiropteran "Chiropteran") can be [Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarians "Barbarians").
- [Gnomes](/wiki/Gnomes "Gnomes") have their [carrying capacity](/wiki/Carrying_capacity "Carrying capacity") increased by 400. (from ndnh1)

* Player [clockwork automata](/wiki/Clockwork_automata "Clockwork automata") have materials. Valid starting materials: bronze, iron, green-steel; but can apply [Silver Flame](/wiki/Silver_Flame "Silver Flame") boons to smelt self to silver, platinum, or mithril (can then apply [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") boon to self)

  - bronze: 2x boiler heat damage dice
  - iron: rusting, sear damage (+1d(defender's level))
  - green-steel: rusting, sear damage (+2d9 unholy)
  - silver: sear damage (+1d20)
  - platinum: sear damage (+1d5 to +1d20)
  - mithril: -3 AC and +3 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR")
  - gold: sear damage (+1d20 holy if [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record")>3, +1d20 unholy if alignment record<-3, else nothing)
  - Rusting is resisted by waterproofing
  - Sear damage only applies on direct contact. Unlike [Eden](/index.php?title=Eden\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Eden (page does not exist)"), there's no passive damage.

## New items

- [Cloak of flight](/wiki/Cloak_of_flight "Cloak of flight") (from [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack")).
- [Night vision goggles](/index.php?title=Night_vision_goggles\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Night vision goggles (page does not exist)") from ndnh1: Uses blindfold slot, provides [extramission](/index.php?title=Extramission\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Extramission (page does not exist)"), [future tech](/wiki/Future_tech "Future tech"). [Anachrononaut](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") dwarves start with them and there is a pair on the Home level (and on the android home level)
- [Force armor](/index.php?title=Force_armor\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Force armor (page does not exist)") from ndnh1: 3 AC, 3 DR, MC3. Heavy armor made of [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone") that can knock back and stun attackers, considered future tech. [Half-dragon](/wiki/Half-dragon_\(starting_race\) "Half-dragon (starting race)") [Anachrononauts](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") start with force armor.
- [Mist projector](/index.php?title=Mist_projector\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mist projector (page does not exist)"): Chargeable [tool](/wiki/Tool "Tool") with the same [charge](/wiki/Charge "Charge") count as a [can of grease](/wiki/Can_of_grease "Can of grease"). Weighs 50 aum, made of [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal"), not randomly generated. When applied, it creates a large cloud of cold with a radius of 3, 4 or 5 squares depending on beatitude - monsters in the cloud that do not have [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") sustain flat damage each turn based on the user's [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"): the cloud deals 3 damage at Unskilled and gains +3 damage for each skill level, up to 12 at Expert. [Migo](/wiki/Migo "Migo") queens/philosophers/soldiers are given mist projectors to replace their gaze attack.

## New options

- usersound\_regex, menucolor\_regex, querytype\_regex
- paranoid\_wand\_break
- QUERYTYPE - similar to msgtype,but controls whether prompts are y/n or yes/no

## Other changes

- More [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") types are available for [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") and [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand"), though [runeswords](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword") are still disallowed.
- [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") learn their special spells at level 14.
- Pets do not untame if left on the [village](/index.php?title=Village\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Village (page does not exist)") level.
- More items [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify").
- [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") is an [isamusei](/index.php?title=Isamusei\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Isamusei (page does not exist)").
- [Etherealoids](/wiki/Etherealoid "Etherealoid") can be given [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield") as [sacrifice gifts](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift").
- [Beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude")-unidentified stacks merge with identical ones.
- [R'lyehian sight](/index.php?title=R%27lyehian_sight\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "R'lyehian sight (page does not exist)") is implemented for players, and is treated as a form of monster detection rather than vision.
- [Lokoban](/wiki/Lokoban "Lokoban") is used in place of Sokoban as in notdNetHack, and Sokoban's luck penalties are also removed.
- New [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") levels from [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack").
- [Brainlessness](/wiki/Brainlessness "Brainlessness") does not bypass [life saving](/wiki/Life_saving "Life saving") - a character that dies of brainlessness has their [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") set to 5 if life-saved.
- [User sounds](/wiki/User_sounds "User sounds") support (from 3.4.3) re-added for Unix.

* *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=NotnotdNetHack\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
NotnotdNetHack

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Not to be confused with notdnethack.

notnotdnethack is a variant of notdNetHack developed by Noisytoot, and is based on NetHack 3.4.3 like both notdNetHack and dNetHack are.

The entire repo can be viewed at codeberg.org.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Proper formatting to match other variant pages"

Contents

  • 1 New races
    • 1.1 Octopode
    • 1.2 (Parasitized) Android Illithanachronounbinder
  • 2 Race/role changes
  • 3 New items
  • 4 New options
  • 5 Other changes

New races

Octopode

Main article: Octopode (starting race)

Octopodes are a race of sea monsters that can use their tentacles to walk on land, wear rings on each of the eight tentacles, and can also attack with them in melee to drown other monsters. They cannot wear most rigid armor, but can still make use of shields and barded helms along with "soft" armor and also gain level-based bonuses to natural AC and DR.

(Parasitized) Android Illithanachronounbinder

Androids can be played as Illithanachronounbinders, which makes them a playable version of the parasitized android. Unlike other androids, Android Illithanachronounbinders are considered living monsters due to the presence of the parasite; they also no longer start with cold resistance, stoning resistance or breathlessness, and instead start with see invisible, R'lyehian sight and flight as parasitized androids do. Android Illithanachronounbinders still begin with poison resistance and sickness resistance, and gain stealth at experience level 5, shock resistance at experience level 10 and fire resistance at experience level 15.

Race/role changes

  • Chiropterans can be Barbarians.
  • Gnomes have their carrying capacity increased by 400. (from ndnh1)
  • Player clockwork automata have materials. Valid starting materials: bronze, iron, green-steel; but can apply Silver Flame boons to smelt self to silver, platinum, or mithril (can then apply reflection boon to self)
    • bronze: 2x boiler heat damage dice
    • iron: rusting, sear damage (+1d(defender's level))
    • green-steel: rusting, sear damage (+2d9 unholy)
    • silver: sear damage (+1d20)
    • platinum: sear damage (+1d5 to +1d20)
    • mithril: -3 AC and +3 DR
    • gold: sear damage (+1d20 holy if alignment record>3, +1d20 unholy if alignment record<-3, else nothing)
    • Rusting is resisted by waterproofing
    • Sear damage only applies on direct contact. Unlike Eden, there's no passive damage.

New items

  • Cloak of flight (from SpliceHack).
  • Night vision goggles from ndnh1: Uses blindfold slot, provides extramission, future tech. Anachrononaut dwarves start with them and there is a pair on the Home level (and on the android home level)
  • Force armor from ndnh1: 3 AC, 3 DR, MC3. Heavy armor made of gemstone that can knock back and stun attackers, considered future tech. Half-dragon Anachrononauts start with force armor.
  • Mist projector: Chargeable tool with the same charge count as a can of grease. Weighs 50 aum, made of metal, not randomly generated. When applied, it creates a large cloud of cold with a radius of 3, 4 or 5 squares depending on beatitude - monsters in the cloud that do not have cold resistance sustain flat damage each turn based on the user's firearms skill: the cloud deals 3 damage at Unskilled and gains +3 damage for each skill level, up to 12 at Expert. Migo queens/philosophers/soldiers are given mist projectors to replace their gaze attack.

New options

  • usersound_regex, menucolor_regex, querytype_regex
  • paranoid_wand_break
  • QUERYTYPE - similar to msgtype,but controls whether prompts are y/n or yes/no

Other changes

  • More base item types are available for Fire Brand and Frost Brand, though runeswords are still disallowed.
  • Wizards learn their special spells at level 14.
  • Pets do not untame if left on the village level.
  • More items auto-identify.
  • Vorpal Blade is an isamusei.
  • Etherealoids can be given shields as sacrifice gifts.
  • Beatitude-unidentified stacks merge with identical ones.
  • R'lyehian sight is implemented for players, and is treated as a form of monster detection rather than vision.
  • Lokoban is used in place of Sokoban as in notdNetHack, and Sokoban's luck penalties are also removed.
  • New Fort Ludios levels from UnNetHack.
  • Brainlessness does not bypass life saving - a character that dies of brainlessness has their intelligence set to 5 if life-saved.
  • User sounds support (from 3.4.3) re-added for Unix.
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=NotnotdNetHack&oldid=177376"

rawPage:
{{distinguish|notdnethack}}
'''notnotdnethack''' is a [[variant]] of [[notdNetHack]] developed by [[User:Noisytoot|Noisytoot]], and is based on [[NetHack 3.4.3]] like both notdNetHack and [[dNetHack]] are.

The entire repo can be viewed at [https://codeberg.org/noisytoot/notnotdnethack/ codeberg.org].

{{todo|Proper formatting to match other variant pages}}

==New races==
===Octopode===
{{main|Octopode (starting race)}}
Octopodes are a race of [[sea monster]]s that can use their tentacles to walk on land, wear rings on each of the eight tentacles, and can also attack with them in melee to drown other monsters. They cannot wear most rigid armor, but can still make use of [[shield]]s and barded [[helm]]s along with "soft" armor and also gain level-based bonuses to natural [[AC]] and [[DR]].

===(Parasitized) Android Illithanachronounbinder===
[[Android]]s can be played as [[Illithanachronounbinder]]s, which makes them a playable version of the [[parasitized android]]. Unlike other androids, Android Illithanachronounbinders are considered living monsters due to the presence of the parasite; they also no longer start with [[cold resistance]], [[stoning resistance]] or [[breathlessness]], and instead start with [[see invisible]], [[R'lyehian sight]] and [[flight]] as parasitized androids do. Android Illithanachronounbinders still begin with [[poison resistance]] and [[sickness resistance]], and gain [[stealth]] at [[experience level]] 5, [[shock resistance]] at experience level 10 and [[fire resistance]] at experience level 15.

==Race/role changes==
* [[Chiropteran]]s can be [[Barbarians]].
* [[Gnomes]] have their [[carrying capacity]] increased by 400. (from ndnh1)

* Player [[clockwork automata]] have materials. Valid starting materials: bronze, iron, green-steel; but can apply [[Silver Flame]] boons to smelt self to silver, platinum, or mithril (can then apply [[reflection]] boon to self)<!--
**[[Mammon]]'s breath changes material to gold -->
** bronze: 2x boiler heat damage dice
** iron: rusting, sear damage (+1d(defender's level))
** green-steel: rusting, sear damage (+2d9 unholy)
** silver: sear damage (+1d20)
** platinum: sear damage (+1d5 to +1d20)
** mithril: -3 AC and +3 [[DR]]
** gold: sear damage (+1d20 holy if [[alignment record]]>3, +1d20 unholy if alignment record<-3, else nothing)
** Rusting is resisted by waterproofing
** Sear damage only applies on direct contact. Unlike [[Eden]], there's no passive damage.
<!--Upstreamed, remove after updating ndnh article-->

==New items==
*[[Cloak of flight]] (from [[SpliceHack]]).
*[[Night vision goggles]] from ndnh1: Uses blindfold slot, provides [[extramission]], [[future tech]]. [[Anachrononaut]] dwarves start with them and there is a pair on the Home level (and on the android home level)<!--Upstreamed, remove after updating ndnh article-->
*[[Force armor]] from ndnh1: 3 AC, 3 DR, MC3. Heavy armor made of [[gemstone]] that can knock back and stun attackers, considered future tech. [[Half-dragon (starting race)|Half-dragon]] [[Anachrononaut]]s start with force armor.
*[[Mist projector]]: Chargeable [[tool]] with the same [[charge]] count as a [[can of grease]].	Weighs 50 aum, made of [[metal]], not randomly generated. When applied, it creates a large cloud of cold with a radius of 3, 4 or 5 squares depending on beatitude - monsters in the cloud that do not have [[cold resistance]] sustain flat damage each turn based on the user's [[firearms]] [[skill]]: the cloud deals 3 damage at Unskilled and gains +3 damage for each skill level, up to 12 at Expert. [[Migo]] queens/philosophers/soldiers are given mist projectors to replace their gaze attack.	

==New options==
* usersound_regex, menucolor_regex, querytype_regex<!--whether to use regex or pmatch-->
* paranoid_wand_break
* QUERYTYPE - similar to msgtype,but controls whether prompts are y/n or yes/no

==Other changes==
* More [[base item]] types are available for [[Fire Brand]] and [[Frost Brand]], though [[runesword]]s are still disallowed.
* [[Wizard]]s learn their special spells at level 14.
* Pets do not untame if left on the [[village]] level.
* More items [[auto-identify]].<!--
* [[Rogue level]] disabled-->
* [[Vorpal Blade]] is an [[isamusei]].
* [[Etherealoid]]s can be given [[shield]]s as [[sacrifice gift]]s.
* [[Beatitude]]-unidentified stacks merge with identical ones.
* [[R'lyehian sight]] is implemented for players, and is treated as a form of monster detection rather than vision.<!--Upstreamed, edit or remove after updating dnh article or creating standalone article. Default ghost and shade symbols are now 8 and 6 respectively -->
* [[Lokoban]] is used in place of Sokoban as in notdNetHack, and Sokoban's luck penalties are also removed.
* New [[Fort Ludios]] levels from [[UnNetHack]].
* [[Brainlessness]] does not bypass [[life saving]] - a character that dies of brainlessness has their [[intelligence]] set to 5 if life-saved.
* [[User sounds]] support (from 3.4.3) re-added for Unix.
